results.title: WipEout 2097 for Sega Saturn
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in Sega Saturn case
results.brief_description: WipEout 2097 is set four decades after its predecessor. The F3600 anti-gravity racing competition from the first game has been replaced by an even faster and more dangerous tournament: the F5000 AG league. The racing and weapon use gameplay from the original WipEout remains the same. The main modes from have also returned, but with the addition of a new Challenge Modes. Completing challenges in this mode rewards the player with faster race speeds, new tracks, and new vehicles.

results.title: WipEout for Sega Saturn
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in Sega Saturn case
results.brief_description:
In the world of WipEout, anti-gravity racing is the world’s most popular sport. Tracks stretch out across the world and research is focused on finding even better and faster race craft. Racing for one of four corporations, the player competes to win the prestigious F3600 Anti-Gravity Racing League. Each corporation’s craft has its own strengths and weaknesses, which are further complicated by the choice of different pilots. Races aren’t simply affairs of speed and manoeuvring. The tracks are littered with weapons and powerups to hinder opponents or aid the player.

The game has three modes. Championship has the player attempting to place in the top three of each class, before proceeding to the next. If a player beats this mode in as the top of the Venom class, Rapier class, with tougher opponents, will be unlocked. Single Race pits the player against a full field of pilots in a single track. Time Trail is like single race, but without weapons.

results.title: The House of the Dead for Sega Saturn
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in Sega Saturn case
results.brief_description:
The House of the Dead is console port of the popular arcade shooter. The player, as agent Thomas Rogan or his partner “G” must rescue Rogan’s fiancée Sophie Richards from the evil scientist Dr. Curien and his undead creations.

This release inherits the same a rail shooter mechanic, where the player is guided through a haunted mansion filled with the undead. The player must shoot any enemies before being attacked while also not shooting any hostages. Items that grant health or different upgrades can also be found. The game also has several points where the player can actively affect the course of the game through their actions. For instance, if a player saves a hostage who is about to be thrown from a bridge, that hostage can open a different route through the game.

This port also contains two extra modes called Saturn Mode and Boss Mode. Saturn mode plays like the arcade game, but offers the player different characters to choose from who have varying attributes like reload time and amount of health. The Boss Mode allows the player to fight one boss of their choosing or all of the game’s four boss monsters consecutively.

results.title: Manx TT SuperBike for Sega Saturn
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in plastic Sega Saturn games case
results.brief_description:
Set in the Isle of Man TT (Tourist Trophy), the world-famous and demanding motorcycle racing event held on the Isle of Man, this Saturn port of the arcade original has two courses to race on: The Laxey Coast course for novices and the more difficult TT Course. While the TT Course is based on the actual track, the Laxey Coast one is a developer creation, although it draws inspiration from the setting.

The Saturn version adds an Arcade Mode, which mimics the original arcade version and a Saturn Mode, which includes additional features such as practice races and a challenge course. Two-player multiplayer is supported via split screen and the game’s soundtrack can be listened to by placing the Saturn disc in a CD player.

results.title: Emulation of Manx TT SuperBike for Sega Saturn
results.material_description: CD-ROM videogame. CD-ROM and manual in plastic Sega Saturn games case
results.brief_description:
Set in the Isle of Man TT (Tourist Trophy), the world-famous and demanding motorcycle racing event held on the Isle of Man, this Saturn port of the arcade original has two courses to race on: The Laxey Coast course for novices and the more difficult TT Course. While the TT Course is based on the actual track, the Laxey Coast one is a developer creation, although it draws inspiration from the setting.

The Saturn version adds an Arcade Mode, which mimics the original arcade version and a Saturn Mode, which includes additional features such as practice races and a challenge course. Two-player multiplayer is supported via split screen and the game’s soundtrack can be listened to by placing the Saturn disc in a CD player.

results.title: [John Anderson Home Movie Collection]
results.material_description: 7x 16mm film assorted newsreels and home movie. Can of 9.5mm assorted smaller reels. Focus on Ballarat. Family collection by filmmaker John (Jack) Anderson (dec.)
results.brief_description:
John Robert (Jack) Anderson (1924–1993) was a film distributor, cinema owner and photographer as well as an enthusiastic filmmaker in and around Ballarat in Victoria. Jack developed an interest in film very early at cinema shows and gained his first film experience while serving in WWII, photographing wartime conditions and aircraft involved in the defence of Australia’s north, including the aftermath of the Darwin bombing raid.

It was whilst working in photographic studios that Jack met his future wife, business partner and fellow film enthusiast Marie Bourke. Starting out by hiring films and showing them around regional Victoria, Jack and Marie established cinemas such as the Astor Cinema in Ararat, Bell Post Hill Drive-In in Geelong and the Southern and Northern Drive-Ins and Vegas 70 Cinema in Ballarat. In the 1970s, the Anderson family acquired and restored the Regent Theatre in Ballarat which would then become the first multiplex in regional Victoria.

Along the way, Jack filmed his family and friends activities and outings, horse racing, Ballarat street scenes, motorcycle scrambling and travel scenes on the road – an unusual and wonderful look at life in regional Victoria during the 1940s to the 1960s.

The collection is filmed on 16mm and 9.5mm film and the films can sometimes be a bit damaged and shaky.

results.title: [John Anderson Home Movies: Reel 36]
results.brief_description:
John Robert (Jack) Anderson (1924–1993) was a film distributor, cinema owner and photographer as well as an enthusiastic filmmaker in and around Ballarat in Victoria. Jack developed an interest in film very early at cinema shows and gained his first film experience while serving in WWII, photographing wartime conditions and aircraft involved in the defence of Australia’s north, including the aftermath of the Darwin bombing raid.

It was whilst working in photographic studios that Jack met his future wife, business partner and fellow film enthusiast Marie Bourke. Starting out by hiring films and showing them around regional Victoria, Jack and Marie established cinemas such as the Astor Cinema in Ararat, Bell Post Hill Drive-In in Geelong and the Southern and Northern Drive-Ins and Vegas 70 Cinema in Ballarat. In the 1970s, the Anderson family acquired and restored the Regent Theatre in Ballarat which would then become the first multiplex in regional Victoria.

Along the way, Jack filmed his family and friends activities and outings, horse racing, Ballarat street scenes, motorcycle scrambling and travel scenes on the road – an unusual and wonderful look at life in regional Victoria during the 1940s to the 1960s.

This film was originally made using 16mm film.

This film shows various recreational activities in the life of the Anderson family, including water skiing, riding speed boats on a lake, a trip to the snow, visiting the Royal Melbourne Show, birthday parties, swimming at a local pool, and a Christmas morning.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 skimming stones at the river

00:11:02:00 sign for ‘Water Ski Spectacular: The Fastest Show on Water’
00:11:18:00 the three boys at a table set with birthday cake and party cups
00:15:04:00 on a speedboat on the lake
00:18:47:00 another birthday party with balloons and cake
00:18:56:00 double-layer sponge cake on a rotating tray (lazy Susan)
00:21:47:00 blowing out the candles on the cake
00:22:33:00 trip to the snow
00:23:18:00 kids learning to ski
00:25:00:00 siblings in matching outfits holding hands at the Royal Show
00:25:12:00 Showbags stall
00:25:17:00 on the Racing Speedboats ride
00:26:15:00 the Kiddies Ferris Wheel
00:26:25:00 the Merry-Go-Round with the older girls holding the boys on
00:27:08:00 on the Speed Car ride
00:27:57:00 girl with fairy floss in front of the fairy floss stand and then thoroughly enjoying it
00:28:13:00 sign for ‘Delicious Flavoured Milk’
00:29:29:00 the Mad Mouse ride
00:30:00:00 Christmas morning with a pile of presents under the tree and the kids in their pyjamas
00:31:25:00 in the backyard riding new bikes and race car toys
00:33:15:00 playing at the local pool with an inflatable boat
00:37:34:00 a large group of kids lined up for a bike race
00:38:37:00 group of girls on the trampoline
00:39:04:00 cake with a ballerina and ‘Happy Birthday to Denise’ written on top
00:39:28:00 blowing party horns
